# Task

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.



# Data

pig_latinify(["hello", "apple", "strong", "world"])

```julia
using Threads

function pig_latinify(words)
    result = String[]
    lock = ReentrantLock()

    for word in words
        @async begin
            new_word = pig_latin_transform(word)
            lock() do
                push!(result, new_word)
            end
        end
    end

    return result
end

function pig_latin_transform(word)
    vowels = "aeiouAEIOU"
    
    if occursin(r"^[bcdfghjklmnpqrstvwxyzBCDFGHJKLMNPQRSTVWXYZ]+$", word) &&
       !occursin(vowels, word[1]))
        return "$(word[2:end])$(word[1])ay"
    elseif occursin(vowels, word[1])
    || occursin(r"^[bcdfghjklmnpqrstvwxyzBCDFGHJKLMNPQRSTVWXYZ]+$(vowels)+", word)
        return "$(word[2:end])$(word[1])ay"
    else
        return "$(word[2:end])$(word[1])$(word[end])ay"
    end
end

words = ["hello", "apple", "strong", "world"]
result = pig_latinify(words)

# Display the result
println(result)
```

This code defines a function `pig_latinify` that takes a vector of strings as input. It uses threads to apply the `pig_latin_transform` function on each word in parallel.

The output of the example given would be:

```julia
["ellohay", "appleway", "ongstray", "orldway"]
```
